data.name: lblDisplayTabId.Help
data.value: Choose which page this item should be displayed on. This list is populated with all of the pages (tabs) in your Portal. Pages with a (*) have an overrideable Publish module on them, meaning they can show multiple types of Engage:Publish content based on the URL.

data.name: lblArticleId.Help
data.value: The ID of the article you are editing.

data.name: lblVersionDescription.Help
data.value: The version description is used for administrative purposes, anything you see here will be included for reference as a change between versions of an article.

data.name: EmbeddedArticle.Help
data.value: If defined, this article will be loaded in the upper right corner of the display module, allowing you to include an embedded article.

data.name: ArticleText.Help
data.value: This is the main article text.

data.name: MaximumLength.Text
data.value: The maximum length has for {0} has been exceeded. MaxLength = {1}, Current Length = {2}

data.name: ParentCategory.Help
data.value: This is the default category an article should fall under. All articles must have a parent category.

data.name: RelatedArticles.Help
data.value: If this article has any related articles, choose them here.

data.name: RelatedCategories.Help
data.value: If this article belongs in multiple categories you can define them here.

data.name: btnStoreRelationshipDate.Help
data.value: Save the dates for this item in this relationship.

data.name: lblEndDate.Help
data.value: The end date for this relationship.

data.name: lblItemSearch.Help
data.value: You can filter the available items through this search.

data.name: lblStartDate.Help
data.value: The start date for this relationship.

data.name: ErrorApprovalStatus.Text
data.value: You must choose set the approval status for this item.

data.name: ErrorSelectCategory.Text
data.value: You must select at least one Category for this article.

data.name: ErrorDisplayPage.Text
data.value: You must choose a page for this category to display on.

data.name: DeleteFailure.Text
data.value: The article could not be deleted

data.name: DeleteConfirm.Text
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete this article?

data.name: DeleteFailureInUse.Text
data.value: This article cannot be deleted because it is in use. Please remove it from the following Article Display modules before deleting it:

data.name: DeleteFailureIsFeatured.Text
data.value: The article could not be deleted because it is a featured item in the following categories:

data.name: EMAIL_APPROVAL_BODY.Text
data.value:
A new article has been marked for approval. The article named : [ENGAGEITEMNAME]

To view this updated version please click here
[ENGAGEITEMLINK]

To view all versions of this article please click here
[ENGAGEITEMSLINK]

data.name: chkIncludeOtherArticlesFromSameList.Text
data.value: Automatically include other articles from the same Article List(s), and/or

data.name: lblNotUsingApprovals.Text
data.value: Approvals are turned off. Any changes you make will appear immediately on your website.

data.name: lblForceDisplayTab.Text
data.value: Force to display on selected page

data.name: lblDisplayLocationOptions.Help
data.value: If you'd like to configure advanced location display options for this item you can do so here.

data.name: ApprovalStatus.Help
data.value: If approvals are turned on for the current article, you can select whether you would like this to remain in an edit state or whether you would like to submit it to be approved by an administrator. Administrators can also approve articles here.

data.name: lblDisplayOptions.Help
data.value: Choose whether each of these items will display on the given article. This overrides any settings on the specific module that is displaying the article.

data.name: lblPostingDates.Help
data.value: Choose the dates that an article should start and stop displaying on the website. If the end date is left blank, the article will continue on indefinately (until a end date is defined, or the article is archived or deleted).

data.name: lblForceDisplayTab.Help
data.value: If checked, all requests for this article will redirect to the chosen display page. Otherwise, only requests through itemlink.aspx will redirect to the chosen page.

data.name: lblPhotoGalleryAlbum.Help
data.value: You can choose to associate an album from the installed SimpleGallery or Ultra Media Gallery module with this article. When the article is displayed, thumbnails from the album will be displayed alongisde the article.

data.name: lblPublishInstructions.Text
data.value:
Basic Engage: Publish Instructions
These instructions can be modified by an Administrator using the DotNetNuke Language Editor.

This page is used for creating a new article or content entry on a website. At minimum you should define a Title, Description and Article Body for this article. You can however, instead of creating an article body use the URL Selection section (with Advanced Properties) to create a link to another source of material, defining a title/description and then the link to where this entry should point.

When you are done defining the content for your article at the bottom of the page you will find the workflow options. Depending on how your administrator has configured the website you might be able to post content immediately to the site (approved) or you might have to go through the process of having your content approved before it will show up live on the website.

data.name: lblPreviousVersionDescription.Help
data.value: This is the version description that was saved with the previous version of the article you are editing. You cannot update this, it is for reference only.

data.name: TagEntry.Help
data.value: Tags are another way of providing a taxonomy for items. You can separate tags by SemiColons (;) in the ext field.

data.name: lblDisplayOnCurrentPage.Help
data.value: Choose the option for this article to display. Current Page means the article will display on the page of any lists that link to that article. Choosing a page from a dropdown list will make all system generated links point to the selected page to display the article. Pages with a (*) have an overrideable Publish module on them, meaning they can show multiple types of Engage:Publish content based on the URL. By checking the "Force" checkbox you will make sure that an article can only be displayed on a specific page, even if requested from another instance of Publish through the querystring.

data.name: EMAIL_STATUSCHANGE_BODY.Text
data.value:
A version of an article you've authored has had a status change to: [ENGAGESTATUS]

Change made by: [ADMINNAME]

The article named : [ENGAGEITEMNAME]
Comments: [ENGAGEITEMCOMMENTS]
To view this updated version please click here
[ENGAGEITEMLINK]

To view all versions of this article please click here
[ENGAGEITEMSLINK]
